description.narrative: Al 2025, los sistemas educativos en los niveles de gobierno priorizados han mejorado sus capacidades para garantizar oportunidades equitativas e inclusivas para acceder y completar la escuela secundaria y que los estudiantes logren apropiarse de los aprendizajes y habilidades fundamentales, transferibles y digitales claves del siglo XXI, con Ã©nfasis en aquellos que viven en mayores condiciones de vulnerabilidad., which contributes to Access To Quality Learning Opportunities, Access To Quality Learning Opportunities (Covid), Learning, Skills, Participation And Engagement, Learning, Skills, Participation And Engagement (Covid). UNICEF aims to achieve this through Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, Systems Strengthening To Leave No One Behind. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: Al 2025, las y los adolescentes, especialmente aquellos que viven en mayores condiciones de vulnerabilidad, lograrÃ¡n concluir el nivel secundario de educaciÃ³n y sus conocimientos fundamentales, transferibles y digitales habrÃ¡n mejorado tomarÃ¡n decisiones informadas y autÃ³nomas sobre su salud y sexualidad, contarÃ¡n con el apoyo requerido para hacerlo y, tomarÃ¡n parte activa de las decisiones que les afectan.

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Al 2025, los sistemas educativos en los niveles de gobierno priorizados han mejorado sus capacidades para garantizar oportunidadesequitativas e inclusivas para acceder y completar la escuela secundaria y que los estudiantes logren apropiarse de los aprendizajesy habilidades fundamentales, transferibles y digitales claves del siglo XXI, con enfasis en aquellos que viven en mayorescondiciones de vulnerabilidad.

description.narrative: UNICEF substantially contributed to the adolescents’ education agenda by strengthening national and prioritized provincial education governments’ capacities. Technical assistance, teachers’ training and financial support were implemented to support governments to guarantee equitable and inclusive learning opportunities for adolescents, especially those in disadvantaged situations. CO supported eight prioritized provinces implementing UNICEF programs for vulnerable urban and rural adolescent schooling reaching nearly 34,607 students and directly to 221 schools, 2,282 teachers, and 264 managers. At the national level, 23,484 teachers were reached through training strategies that improve teaching and learning practices in fundamental, transferable, and digital skills. | Status:Met | As-of Date:14/01/2022
